name: Really loving the ever-expanding community of indie bloggers on Micro.blog. It really does feel like the “good old days” of Twitter!

content.html: Really loving the ever-expanding community of indie bloggers on Micro.blog. It really does feel like the “good old days” of Twitter!
content.value: Really loving the ever-expanding community of indie bloggers on Micro.blog. It really does feel like the “good old days” of Twitter!

summary: @cleverdevil It does indeed. But I wonder what we could be doing to invite a more diverse set of voices? The community seems pretty techie and male at the moment, though that could be just the people I follow…

content.html: @cleverdevil It does indeed. But I wonder what we could be doing to invite a more diverse set of voices? The community seems pretty techie and male at the moment, though that could be just the people I follow…
content.value: @cleverdevil It does indeed. But I wonder what we could be doing to invite a more diverse set of voices? The community seems pretty techie and male at the moment, though that could be just the people I follow…

summary: @Bruce agreed. It’s not atypical of early stage communities in the web though. I do think it’s something worth focusing on.

content.html: @Bruce agreed. It’s not atypical of early stage communities in the web though. I do think it’s something worth focusing on.
